intro: Dumasia nitida, commonly known as the silverleaf dudleya, is a succulent plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It features dense, silver-gray foliage with a waxy coating that helps reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Dumasia nitida thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, requiring minimal care once established.
